refnamediv.refpurpose: A GtkToolItem subclass that displays buttons

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Properties
refsect1.synopsis: "icon-widget" GtkWidget : Read / Write "label" gchararray : Read / Write "label-widget" GtkWidget : Read / Write "stock-id" gchararray : Read / Write "use-underline" gboolean : Read / Write

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Use gtk_tool_button_new() to create a new GtkToolButton. Use gtk_tool_button_new_with_stock() to create a GtkToolButton containing a stock item.

The label of a GtkToolButton is determined by the properties "label_widget", "label", and "stock_id". If "label_widget" is non-NULL, then that widget is used as the label. Otherwise, if "label" is non-NULL, that string is used as the label. Otherwise, if "stock_id" is non-NULL, the label is determined by the stock item. Otherwise, the button does not have a label.

The icon of a GtkToolButton is determined by the properties "icon_widget" and "stock_id". If "icon_widget" is non-NULL, then that widget is used as the icon. Otherwise, if "stock_id" is non-NULL, the icon is determined by the stock item. Otherwise, the button does not have a label.

refsect2.title: struct GtkToolButton
refsect2.para: The GtkToolButton struct contains only private. It should only be accessed with the function described below.

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_button_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkToolButton using icon_widget as icon and label as label.

listitem.simpara: a widget that will be used as icon widget, or NULL
a string that will be used as label, or NULL
A new GtkToolButton

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_button_new_from_stock ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkToolButton containing the image and text from a stock item. Some stock ids have preprocessor macros like GTK_STOCK_OK and GTK_STOCK_APPLY.
It is an error if stock_id is not a name of a stock item.

listitem.simpara: the name of the stock item
A new GtkToolButton

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_button_set_label ()
refsect2.para: Sets label as the label used for the tool button. The "label" property only has an effect if not overridden by a non-NULL "label_widget" property. If both the "label_widget" and "label" properties are NULL, the label is determined by the "stock_id" property. If the "stock_id" property is also NULL, button will not have a label.

listitem.simpara: a GtkToolButton
a string that will be used as label, or NULL.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_button_get_label ()
refsect2.para: Returns the label used by the tool button, or NULL if the tool button doesn't have a label. or uses a the label from a stock item. The returned string is owned by GTK+, and must not be modified or freed.

listitem.simpara: a GtkToolButton
The label, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_button_set_use_underline ()
refsect2.para: If set, an underline in the label property indicates that the next character should be used for the mnemonic accelerator key in the overflow menu. For example, if the label property is "_Open" and use_underline is TRUE, the label on the tool button will be "Open" and the item on the overflow menu will have an underlined 'O'.
Labels shown on tool buttons never have mnemonics on them; this property only affects the menu item on the overflow menu.

listitem.simpara: a GtkToolButton
whether the button label has the form "_Open"

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_button_get_use_underline ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether underscores in the label property are used as mnemonics on menu items on the overflow menu. See gtk_tool_button_set_use_underline().

listitem.simpara: a GtkToolButton
TRUE if underscores in the label property are used as mnemonics on menu items on the overflow menu.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_button_set_stock_id ()
refsect2.para: Sets the name of the stock item. See gtk_tool_button_new_from_stock(). The stock_id property only has an effect if not overridden by non-NULL "label" and "icon_widget" properties.

listitem.simpara: a GtkToolButton
a name of a stock item, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_button_get_stock_id ()
refsect2.para: Returns the name of the stock item. See gtk_tool_button_set_stock_id(). The returned string is owned by GTK+ and must not be freed or modifed.

listitem.simpara: a GtkToolButton
the name of the stock item for button.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_button_set_icon_widget ()
refsect2.para: Sets icon as the widget used as icon on button. If icon_widget is NULL the icon is determined by the "stock_id" property. If the "stock_id" property is also NULL, button will not have an icon.

listitem.simpara: a GtkToolButton
the widget used as icon, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_button_get_icon_widget ()
refsect2.para: Return the widget used as icon widget on button. See gtk_tool_button_set_icon_widget().

listitem.simpara: a GtkToolButton
The widget used as icon on button, or NULL.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_button_set_label_widget ()
refsect2.para: Sets label_widget as the widget that will be used as the label for button. If label_widget is NULL the "label" property is used as label. If "label" is also NULL, the label in the stock item determined by the "stock_id" property is used as label. If "stock_id" is also NULL, button does not have a label.

listitem.simpara: a GtkToolButton
the widget used as label, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_tool_button_get_label_widget ()
refsect2.para: Returns the widget used as label on button. See gtk_tool_button_set_label_widget().

listitem.simpara: a GtkToolButton
The widget used as label on button, or NULL.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

listitem.para: Icon widget to display in the item.
Text to show in the item.
Widget to use as the item label.
The stock icon displayed on the item.
If set, an underline in the label property indicates that the next character should be used for the mnemonic accelerator key in the overflow menu.

refsect2.title: The "clicked" signal
refsect2.para: This signal is emitted when the tool button is clicked with the mouse or activated with the keyboard.

listitem.simpara: the object that emitted the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

listitem.para: A subclass of GtkToolButton that displays toggle buttons on the toolbar
A subclass of GtkToolButton that displays radio buttons on the toolbar
A subclass of GtkToolItem that separates groups of items on a toolbar
